text.plotgw.page.title: LIGO-Virgo Compact Binary Catalogue
text.plotgw.information.heading: Information:
text.plotgw.information.title: Information Panel
text.plotgw.information.subtitle: Click on datapoints for more information
text.plotgw.presets.title: Presets
text.plotgw.presets.filter-warn: Warning: filters may be updated when using these presets
text.plotgw.axiszero: Force axes to start at zero
text.plotgw.help.title: Help
text.plotgw.help.text:
Explore the LIGO-Virgo compact binary catalogue, which is all the mergers of Black Holes and neutron stars detected by the LIGO-Virgo detectors.

Click on the markers on the graph to show information about the various detections
text.plotgw.help.about: This web-app was written and is maintained by Chris North (Cardiff University). Source code is available on GitHub.
text.plotgw.help.tech: The points in this graph show the best fit values, which are the medians of the posterior probability distributions. The error bars indicate the 90% credible interval. All values are in the source frame of the source (i.e. no redshifts applied). Where applicable, the uncertainties assume astrophysical priors. Further details are available at the Gravitational Wave Open Science Center.
text.plotgw.help.info: Show information about the selected detection
text.plotgw.help.settings: Change the graph properties, such as the horizontal and vertical axes
text.plotgw.help.errors: Turn errors on and off, both in the graph and the information panel
text.plotgw.help.lang: Change the language the web-app is displayed in
text.plotgw.help.share: Share the web-app to friends and/or followers
text.plotgw.lang.title: Language
text.plotgw.lang.text: Chose your language from the options below
text.plotgw.filter.title: Filter Data
text.bub.page.title: חורים שחורים ידועים במסות שמשיות
text.bub.footer:
Hosted by Cardiff University School of Physics and Astronomy.
Maintained by Chris North on behalf of the LIGO Scientific Collaboration. View the source on GitHub.
Gravitational Wave data from Gravitational Wave Open Science Center. X-ray binary data based on stellarcollapse.org/bhmasses.
text.bub.help.scalemass: Scale circle area by black hole mass
text.bub.help.scalesize: Scale circle radius by black hole radius
text.bub.help.tech: Gravitational wave source properties show either the best-fit values (medians of posterior probability distributions) or the 90% credible intervals. All values are in the source frame of the source (i.e. no redshifts applied). Further details are available at the Gravtiational Wave Open Science Center. X-ray binary data is based on stellarcollapse.org/bhmasses.
share.plotgw.twitter.text: Look at this Binary Black Hole catalogue of @LIGO and @ego_virgo observations
share.bub.twitter.text: Look at this Black Hole Bubble Plot showing @LIGO and @ego_virgo observations
